newsitem.title: PERU: Lima shrs close lower, investors remain sidelined.
newsitem.headline: Lima shrs close lower, investors remain sidelined.

text.p: Shares on the Lima stock exchange closed lower Tuesday as investors remained sidelined waiting for third quarter earnings reports, brokers said.
A rebound Wednesday was unlikely as the economy's slower- than-expected growth has also made investors reluctant to enter the market, they added.
Tuesday, the General Index .IGRA fell 0.82 percent to 1,554.25 points, while the blue-chip Selective Index .ISEL dropped 1.12 percent to 2,098.64 points, according to preliminary stock figures.
"Investors showed they prefer to see financial results and improved (gross domestic) product figures before deciding to enter the market," said Luis Ramirez of local brokerage Macrovalores.
Only one blue-chip stock has so far published its third quarter results -- tin-miner Minsur, which remained stable Tuesday at 25.00 soles in 5.24 million soles worth of trade.
The Peruvian economy grew 2.0 percent in the first eight months of the year, compared to 8.4 percent in the same period of 1995, the government announced.

While investors recognized as prudent the government's policy of slowing the economy down at the beginning of the year, they had been hoping for a quicker recovery in the second half than has so far been seen, brokers said.

In a total of 2,143 trades, 36 stocks fell, 35 were stable and 25 rose in volume of 64.2 million ($25.0 million). A single cross-trade between local brokerages Argos and Surinvest in the shares of pension fund AFP Horizonte accounted for 55 percent of the day's total volume.
Accounting for 11 percent of the market's volume, benchmark Telefnica del Per was the most heavily traded stock after this cross-trade, as it fell 0.88 percent to 5.65 soles.
